result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse Gordon Dismukes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant is non-compliant with the conditions of Probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse Gordon Dismukes

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Order, signed and filed.  

The defendant's motion or requestg for release privileges is denied.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, the motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Michelle Ackerman Havas, Br. 45, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for Huber privileges after revocation of probation.
Reflects 02-09-16 Court order imposing 45 days of condition time

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court, Defendant Jesse Gordon Dismukes not in court, in custody.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced for purposes of this hearing.  Order for Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance with Probation Conditions for a period of 45 Days in the House of Correction was previously ordered and signed by Judge Michael Malmstad on 02-09-2016.
Order For Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance with Probation Conditions received, signed, and filed with court.
Order for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Conditions and forwarded to Br 4, for review. os

Defendant Jesse Gordon Dismukes in court with attorney Alexis Liggins. Matt Adrian appearing under the Student Practice Rules as supervised by Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Sentencing Proceeded. Statements made by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, straight time.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-45 days conditions time STAYED to be used at the discretion of the agent.
-Absolute Sobriety
-Maintain full time work, school, and/or volunteer work.
-Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be entered. 

Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief. 

Case adjourned to branch 45 for a Probation Review Hearing.  Review hearing scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Jesse Gordon Dismukes in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.   Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing in Branch 45.  Court ordered Defendant to provide a DNA specimen.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Violation Report received and filed:  missed telephone contact on 7-06-2015.  Court takes no action and will address the matter on the next court date of 9-22-2015.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court, defendant Jesse Gordon Dismukes not in court, in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant not produced.  Pretrial conference held.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Court orders case adjourned to Br 23.  Plea/Schedule scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers. 
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Sentry.

Defendant Jesse Gordon Dismukes in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Jesse Gordon Dismukes in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Jesse Gordon Dismukes
Current: 1368 North 72nd Street, Wauwatosa, WI 53213   (Effective: 05-04-2015)
Prior: 1376 North 72nd Street, Wauwatosa, WI 53213
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
